title: Can my wages be garnished for a public defenders services 17 years ago?
question: I was told my wages are being garnished for San Bernardino Co. Public Defenders services I recieved 17 yrs ago. I was under the impression that this service was provided under my Miranda Rights? I had no knowledge of an outstanding debt until my wages were garnished. At the time of service I was unemployed.
answers: You should check the notice of levy (wage garnishment) for the case number, and go look at the court file. It should contain a copy of the writ of execution being levied. The writ of execution should list the date of the judgment or order requiring reimbursement. Check the judgment or order to see why reimbursement of the public defender's fees was required. If the judgment is more than 10 years old, you should also check the court file to make sure it was renewed. You should consult with the attorney of your choice to discuss the particulars of the matter or for any specific legal advice.
